snippet: A senior United Nations envoy said Tuesday that he had persuaded President Bashar al-Assad to stop bombing and shelling the northern city of Aleppo as part of a proposed six-week truce.
abstract: United Nations envoy Staffan de Mistura says he has convinced Syrian Pres Bashar al-Assad to stop bombing and shelling the northern city of Aleppo as part of a proposed six-week truce.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and ANNE BARNARD
byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta reported from the United Nations, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon. Reporting was contributed by Karam Shoumali from Istanbul, Hwaida Saad and Mohammad Ghannam from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: A senior United Nations envoy said Tuesday that he had persuaded President Bashar al-Assad to stop bombing and shelling the northern city of Aleppo as part of a proposed six-week truce.

headline.main: U.N. Envoy to Syria Announces Possible Truce in Aleppo
headline.print_headline: U.N. Envoy to Syria Announces Possible Truce in Aleppo
